xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class NestedLoopsGrouper

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<Cursor<E>>
      xxl.core.cursors.groupers.NestedLoopsGrouper<Tuple>
          xxl.core.relational.cursors.NestedLoopsGrouper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<Cursor<Tuple>>, Cursor<Cursor<Tuple>>, MetaDataCursor<Cursor<Tuple>,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class NestedLoopsGrouper
extends NestedLoopsGrouper<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Cursor<Tuple>,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>

A nested-loops grouper is an implementation of the group operator. It is based on NestedLoopsGrouper and additionally forwards the metadata.

A call to the next method returns a cursor containing all elements of a group.

Usually, an Aggregator is applied on the output of a grouper.

Constructor Detail

NestedLoopsGrouper

public NestedLoopsGrouper(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor,
                          Function<? super Tuple,? extends Object> mapping,
                          Map<Object,Bag<Tuple>> map,
                          int memSize,
                          int objectSize,
                          int keySize,
                          Function<?,? extends Bag<Tuple>> newBag,
                          Function<?,? extends Queue<Tuple>> newQueue)
Constructs an instance of the nested-loops grouper operator. Determines the maximum number of keys that can be stored in the main memory map 
   ((memSize - objectSize) / keySize) - 1
This formula is based on the assumption that only the keys, i.e., the map, is stored in main memory whereas the bags storing the input cursor's elements are located in external memory.

Parameters:
cursor - the metadata cursor containing input elements.
mapping - an unary mapping function returning a key to a given value.
map - the map which is used for storing the keys in main memory.
memSize - the maximum amount of available main memory (bytes) for the map.
objectSize - the size (bytes) needed to store one element.
keySize - the size (bytes) a key needs in main memory.
newBag - a parameterless function returning an empty bag.
newQueue - a parameterless function returning an empty queue.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if not enough main memory is available.

NestedLoopsGrouper

public NestedLoopsGrouper(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor,
                          Function<? super Tuple,? extends Object> mapping,
                          Map<Object,Bag<Tuple>> map,
                          int memSize,
                          int objectSize,
                          int keySize)
Constructs an instance of the nested-loops grouper operator. Determines the maximum number of keys that can be stored in the main memory map 
   ((memSize - objectSize) / keySize) - 1
This formula is based on the assumption that only the keys, i.e., the map, is stored in main memory whereas the bags storing the input cursor's elements are located in external memory. Uses default factory methods for list-bags and array-queues.

Parameters:
cursor - the metadata cursor containing input elements.
mapping - an unary mapping function returning a key to a given value.
map - the map which is used for storing the keys in main memory.
memSize - the maximum amount of available main memory (bytes) for the map.
objectSize - the size (bytes) needed to store one element.
keySize - the size (bytes) a key needs in main memory.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if not enough main memory is available.

Constructs an instance of the nested-loops grouper operator. Determines the maximum number of keys that can be stored in the main memory map 
   ((memSize - objectSize) / keySize) - 1
This formula is based on the assumption that only the keys, i.e., the map, is stored in main memory whereas the bags storing the input result set's elements are located in external memory.

Parameters:
resultSet - the result set containing input elements.
mapping - an unary mapping function returning a key to a given value.
map - the map which is used for storing the keys in main memory.
memSize - the maximum amount of available main memory (bytes) for the map.
objectSize - the size (bytes) needed to store one element.
keySize - the size (bytes) a key needs in main memory.
newBag - a parameterless function returning an empty bag.
newQueue - a parameterless function returning an empty queue.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if not enough main memory is available.

Constructs an instance of the nested-loops grouper operator. Determines the maximum number of keys that can be stored in the main memory map 
   ((memSize - objectSize) / keySize) - 1
This formula is based on the assumption that only the keys, i.e., the map, is stored in main memory whereas the bags storing the input result set's elements are located in external memory. Uses default factory methods for list-bags and array-queues.
